properties.name: Mount Kenya
properties.description: Africa's second-highest mountain and Kenya's highest peak, a UNESCO World Heritage site and critical water catchment

properties.name: Aberdare Range
properties.description: Provides water for Sasumua and Ndakaini dams, supplying most of Nairobi's water. Supplies 55% of Kenya's hydroelectric power

properties.name: Mau Forest Complex
properties.description: Kenya's largest water tower and indigenous montane forest. Feeds Lakes Victoria, Turkana, Baringo, Nakuru, and Natron. Critical for Mara-Serengeti ecosystem

properties.name: Cherangani Hills
properties.description: One of Kenya's 'big five' water catchments. Watershed between Lake Victoria and Lake Turkana basins. Turkwel River feeds Turkwel Dam for hydroelectric power

properties.name: Mount Elgon
properties.description: Trans-boundary water tower shared with Uganda. Named after the Elgeyo tribe. Catchment for Lakes Victoria, Turkana, and Kyoga (Uganda)

properties.name: Chyulu Hills
properties.description: 100km volcanic field with porous rock allowing underground water storage. Feeds Mzima Springs, supplying one-third of Mombasa's water. No permanent surface rivers

properties.name: Huri Hills
properties.description: Remote highland region near Kenya-Ethiopia border. Home to Gabra and Borana pastoralist communities

properties.name: Kirisia Hills
properties.description: Important water catchment for northern Kenya pastoralist communities

properties.name: Loita Hills
properties.description: Naimina Enkiyio Forest. Significant water catchment in southern Kenya drylands, borders Mara Game Reserve. Trustland under Narok County. Critical dry season grazing area

properties.name: Marmanet Forest
properties.description: Serves Rift Valley drainage system. Provides water to Lake Baringo, Lake Bogoria, Buffalo Springs, and Shaba National Reserves

properties.name: Mathews Range
properties.description: Also known as Lenkiyio Hills. Mountain range in northern Kenya

properties.name: Mount Kipipiri
properties.description: Mountain in central Kenya, part of the Aberdare ecosystem

properties.name: Mount Kulal
properties.description: Located in northern Kenya. Eastern side drops to Chalbi Desert, western side to Lake Turkana. Serves Ewaso Ng'iro North Catchment with 23 springs (20 permanent, 3 seasonal)

properties.name: Mount Marsabit
properties.description: Volcanic mountain and important water source in northern Kenya's arid region

properties.name: Mount Nyiru (Mount Njiru)
properties.description: Located in northern Kenya. Originally covered 26,107ha of forest and 19,211ha of grasslands in 1990

properties.name: Ndotos (Ndottos Range)
properties.description: Located in northeastern Samburu County, between Mathews Range and Mount Nyiru. Mt. Poi (2050m) is part of this range. Source of springs for pastoralist communities

properties.name: Nyambene Hills
properties.description: Volcanic mountain range on northeastern slopes of Mount Kenya. Part of Nyambene Forest Reserve. Known for miraa (khat) cultivation. Sacred sites for Ameru community

properties.name: Shimba Hills
properties.description: Coastal water tower. Biodiversity conservation hotspot. Marere Springs supplies water to Kwale and Mombasa counties. Protected as National Reserve and gazetted forests
